titleStmt.title: A discouerie of the true causes why Ireland was neuer entirely subdued, nor brought vnder obedience of the crowne of England, vntill the beginning of his Maiesties happie raigne
Discoverie of the true causes why Ireland was never entirely subdued
titleStmt.author: Davies, John, Sir, 1569-1626.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed [by W. Jaggard] for Iohn Iaggard, dwelling within Temple Bar, at the signe of the Hand and Star,

notesStmt.note: On A3r: "Dedicated to the King, by his Maiesties Atturney Generall, of Ireland", i.e. Sir John Davies.
The first leaf is blank except for signature-mark "A".
The last page contains errata. Variant: the last page is blank.
Identified as STC 6348a on UMI microfilm 591.
Reproductions of the originals in the Folger Shakespeare Library and the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
Appears at reel 591 (Folger Shakespeare Library copy) and at reel 1348 (Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery copy).

place.placeName: Temple Bar, at the signe of the Hand
